stepAnswer: a common, not necessarily unhealthy, side effect of grief, marked by a sense of pulling away from others and the world, a deep internalization of the grieving process
choices: a common, not necessarily unhealthy, side effect of grief, marked by a sense of pulling away from others and the world, a deep internalization of the grieving process
when social networks change after a loss. The bereaved may feel alienated or detached from their usual social groups due to the shared history and memories with the deceased
a decreased capacity for empathy over time due to repeated exposure to traumatic events or losses
